newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Euroyen hit new contract highs on JGB rally.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Euroyen hit new contract highs on JGB rally.

text.p: SIMEX Euroyen and Japanese government bond (JGB) futures shot to new highs on Tuesday on a positive 10-year JGB auction and a sharp drop in Japan's leading and coincident indicators for August.
"The coincident and leading indicators tumbled hard. And the important thing is, they were both below the key 50 mark, suggesting a slowing economy," said a trader with a European institution.
"The curve continues to flatten as people move their timing for a rate hike further out. They were not just buying but also selling the spread," he added.
The benchmark June Euroyen was quoted at a new high of 99.25 in late trade against its CME close at 99.20. March was at 99.37 against 99.34.
December JGBs rose above their previous high of 123.72 on SIMEX on swap-related buying early in the day, and continued to march upwards after the indicators and auction results.
They settled at 123.96 against their opening 123.60 after touching the psychological resistance level of 124.00.

"The big level everyone is looking for is 125.05, which is the all-time benchmark low yield," said the trader, adding that a break above the resistance area of 124.30 would take the contract into new territory.
But he said the market had already absorbed all Tuesday's positive factors and would need a burst of fresh good news to maintain its upward momentum.
Eurodollar futures finished steady in thin trade amid a lack of fresh leads ahead of the U.S. Treasury's two-year note auction. March ended at 94.30 against its CME close at 94.31.
Dealers said the market failed to react to comments by New York Federal Reserve Bank President William McDonough, who said the Fed needed to continue keeping a close watch on inflation.
"These were just the usual Fed mantras. There was nothing you could construe from them," said the trader.
